0.title: Student Presenter Application (2020)
0.description:
Deadline for participants’ online applications: Thursday, Feb. 20, 2020 at 11:59 p.m.

(Note: * indicates a required field. Please contact us at ug.research@wsu.edu if you need any assistance with filling out this application.)

fields.label: Major(s)
fields.description: Select your major(s) or intended major(s) if not certified at this time. Note: you can make multiple selections from the drop down field below.

fields.label: Name of your WSU research mentor
fields.description: This is the person who mentors you in the research, scholarship, or creative activities you will be presenting at SURCA.

fields.label: Do you have additional WSU research mentors?

choices.text: Yes, I have one or more additional WSU research mentors that I still need to list.
choices.value: Yes, I have one or more additional WSU research mentors that I still need to list.

inputs.label: Yes, I have one or more additional WSU research mentors that I still need to list.

fields.description: (Most of our students have only one WSU research mentor. However, sometimes a student is officially mentored by two or more WSU research mentors collaborating on a joint research project. Note: You will still need to list all of your co-authors below.)

fields.label: Additional WSU research mentor(s)
fields.description: List any additional WSU research mentors using the table below. These are people who should be listed in the 2020 SURCA abstract book alongside the mentor you already entered in the field above. (You can look at last year's 2019 abstract book for examples.)

rules.value: Yes, I have one or more additional WSU research mentors that I still need to list.

fields.label: Number of semesters in research
fields.description: How many semesters (not including summers) have you been involved in mentored undergraduate research?

fields.label: Number of summers in research
fields.description: How many summers have you been involved in mentored undergraduate research?

fields.label: Is this a joint presentation?
fields.description: Will more than one undergraduate student be presenting this poster together at SURCA?

fields.label: Names of joint presenters
fields.description:
(NOTE: Your other joint presenters must each submit their own application with an identical abstract.)
Some presentations will have two or more undergraduates that have worked together and will present their poster together at SURCA.
Note: Please enter one joint presenter per row; click/tap the plus (+) symbol to add more rows. Do not include yourself, only your joint presenter(s).

fields.label: Names of all co-authors
fields.description:
List all of the co-authors on your project in order of their degree of involvement in the workIn other words, the most active contributors to your project should be listed first.. DO NOT include yourself. PLEASE INCLUDE any mentors if they are a co-author on your project.
Note: Please enter one co-author per row; click/tap the plus (+) symbol to add more rows.

fields.label: Presentation method

choices.text: I will come to Pullman to present my poster.
choices.value: I will come to Pullman to present my poster.

choices.text: I will present virtually through the Global Campus.
choices.value: I will present virtually through the Global Campus.

fields.description: Since you are not on the Pullman campus, choose from the following two options on how you will present at SURCA:

fields.label: Do you have any special needs?
fields.description:
Do you have any need for special accommodations? Please describe any specific accommodations you will need based on disabilities, conditions, or injuries that limit access to SURCA facilities.

Do you have any special presentation needs? For example, do you need electrical power to show some of your work on a laptop beside your poster — perhaps to show recorded portions of a performance, etc.? Do you have a sculpture or painting that you will be presenting (please specify size)? Will you require a table for your laptop, sculpture, or other media? Please note that electrical power availability and tables are limited.

fields.label: About the Project You Are Presenting
Project category

choices.text: Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, and Information Sciences
choices.value: Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, and Information Sciences

choices.text: Organismal, Population, Ecological, and Evolutionary Biology
choices.value: Organismal, Population, Ecological, and Evolutionary Biology

fields.description: For more information on each category, check the participation categories page.

fields.label: Abstract
fields.description:
In up to 350 words, describe your research or creative activities in language understandable by a general audience (here are some examples). Please check and correct any special characters or formatting (e.g. subscripts, superscripts, bold text, line breaks, etc.) before submitting.
Notes:
1. You may use a different abstract on the day of the event that is more detailed.
2. Please include only the body text of your abstract in this field; it is not necessary to repeat the title of your project or author list along with your abstract text.
fields.placeholder: HINTS ON WHAT TO WRITE: Introduce your research/creative topic and its importance... What was your scientific hypothesis or creative goal... For a creative project, is there any background or history on your topic that you should mention... What methods did you use in your work... What were the results of your experiments or creative activities... What conclusion did you reach...

0.schedulePendingMessage: Thank you for your interest in applying to present at SURCA 2020! We plan to open this application on Monday, December 2, 2019 at 8am. In the meantime, you can contact ug.research@wsu.edu if you have any further questions.
0.scheduleMessage: The application for participating in SURCA 2020 is now closed. The deadline was Thursday, February 20, 2020 at midnight. You can contact ug.research@wsu.edu if you have any further questions.

notifications.name: Admin Notification
notifications.subject: New submission from {form_title}
notifications.message:
SURCA 2020 student presenter form submission #{entry_id} from {ip} received on {date_mdy}.

{all_fields}

notifications.name: Student Notification
notifications.subject: Thank you for applying to SURCA 2020
notifications.message:
Dear {Student Name (First):1.3}:

This note is to acknowledge that the abstract you submitted for the Showcase for Undergraduate Research and Creative Activities has been received by SURCA staff. Thank you for your interest in participating in the ninth annual event, which concludes the scheduled activities for this year's WSU Showcase. Sharing the results of your research, scholarship, and creative activity efforts at SURCA with judges, faculty, staff, students, and the public will be a fun and rewarding learning experience for you—one that will add a great deal to your college experience.

Here are a few notes with important information for you:

COPY TO YOUR MENTOR: A copy of your abstract will be sent to {Mentor Name (First):8.3} {Mentor Name (Last):8.6}, whom you listed as your mentor when you completed the online form.

NOTIFICATION DATE: You—and all others who submitted abstracts—will be notified by Friday, March 6, 2020 as to whether you have been selected to participate in SURCA 2020. Please check your email.

DATES AND DETAILS: SURCA 2020 will take place throughout the afternoon of Monday, March 30, 2020 in the CUB ballrooms. Details for all participants are on the website at surca.wsu.edu. Be sure to read through the site to understand SURCA and your role in it.

Please contact my office by email if you have questions: ug.research@wsu.edu.

—Shelley Pressley, Ph.D.
Director, WSU Office of Undergraduate Research
Division of Academic Engagement and Student Achievement, Office of the Provost

Additional Opportunity

Are you interested in applying for one of four $500 undergraduate research awards from the WSU Emeritus Society? Undergraduate students who submit an abstract for SURCA are eligible for these awards, which recognize significant contributions to research and outstanding creative and scholarly achievements by undergraduates. One $500 award is granted in each of the following four areas:

  • Arts and Humanities
  • Biosciences
  • Physical Sciences
  • Social, Economic, and Behavioral Sciences

The deadline to apply for the award is Friday, March 13, 2020. The application instructions can be found on the WSU Emeritus Society website. All questions about awards from this organization should be directed to emeritussociety@wsu.edu.

notifications.name: Mentor Notification
notifications.subject: Notification of SURCA 2020 abstract submission
notifications.message:
Dear {Mentor Name (First):8.3},

This note is to let you know that your undergraduate research mentee, {Student Name (First):1.3} {Student Name (Last):1.6}, has just submitted an abstract to participate in the ninth annual Showcase for Undergraduate Research and Creative Activities (SURCA) this spring. {Student Name (First):1.3} listed you as his/her research mentor (please see your student’s submitted application below).

Please consider signing up to judge at SURCA. The SURCA staff will make sure that you are not scheduled to judge your own students’ poster. Details about the judging process are available on the website.

Part of WSU Showcase Week, SURCA is the sole opportunity for our university’s undergraduates in all majors, grades, and campuses to publicly present their “research, scholarship, and creative activities.” Every participant is eligible for awards in eight categories. (Please visit the website at surca.wsu.edu for detailed information.)

We would like to commend you for your mentoring efforts and thank you for supporting this undergraduate’s desire to take part in SURCA. It is a high-profile university event that offers every student the chance to explain their research to judges, university guests, and the community. We hope to see you there.

Important dates: SURCA is set for the afternoon of Monday, March 30, 2020 in the CUB ballrooms. {Student Name (First):1.3} will be notified by Friday, March 6 whether they have been accepted to present at the event. Please note that students need to be standing at their poster to discuss their research with judges from 2:45 - 3:45. Judging itself will take place from 2:00 – 3:45 and ONLY judges are permitted to enter before 3:30; members of the public (including faculty who are not judging) are welcome to attend between 3:30 – 5:00.

Sincerely,

—Shelley Pressley, Ph.D.
Director, WSU Office of Undergraduate Research
Division of Academic Engagement and Student Achievement, Office of the Provost

Submission from {Student Name (First):1.3} {Student Name (Last):1.6} received on {date_mdy}:

{all_fields}

confirmations.name: Default Confirmation
confirmations.message:
Thank you for your submission

We have successfully received your submission for SURCA and have sent a confirmation email to you at {Email:6}. Included below is a copy of what we received (print this page for your records).

Additional Opportunity

Are you interested in applying for one of four $500 undergraduate research scholarships from the WSU Emeritus Society? Undergraduate students who submit an abstract for SURCA are eligible for these awards, which recognize significant contributions to research and outstanding creative and scholarly achievements by undergraduates. One $500 award is granted in each of the following five areas:

  • Arts, humanities, and creative activities
  • Biosciences
  • Engineering and applied science
  • Physical sciences and mathematics
  • Social, economic, and behavioral sciences

The application form for these awards, along with the instructions and deadline for submitting it, will be posted on the WSU Emeritus Society website. All questions about awards from this organization should be directed to emeritussociety@wsu.edu.
